intro: Ossaea grandifolia, commonly known as the large-flowered ossaea, is a species of flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its tall, erect stems and clusters of small, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically broad and lance-shaped, with a slightly hairy surface. Ossaea grandifolia is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or open areas.
